channel.title: Who ever decided that "backspace" was a good key for going back?
channel.description:
First off this has been pissing me off since windows 95.
Who ever decided that backspace was a good key for goind "back"? Whoever came up with this is an asshole :fffuuu:
But in all seriousness, is there anyway to change this?

item.title: Who ever decided that "backspace" was a good key for going back?
item.dc:creator: Theevilpplz
item.description:
Winged One:

If you are on any worthwhile browser, it stores what you’ve written so for in memory so that if you press forward, it’ll still have it.

Whenever that happens, I always expect that all my message has gone. Each time I go forward I praise Google.
All hail Google
All hail Google
All hail Google :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Who ever decided that "backspace" was a good key for going back?
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Samapico:

…

There is a way… don’t hit backspace?

You’re talking about windows explorer, right? Alt-left / Alt-right are the common shortcuts for back/next in web browsers.

Dude, shut the hell up. Just because you don’t agree with something does’nt mean you have to try and destroy a thread by piece. Not everyone know all this stuff about the internet.

Anyways, this thread title made me laugh. Because the button pisses me off when I type a long message and for, SOME REASON, when I click backspace it takes me back losing my whole message.

Read full topic
item.source: Who ever decided that "backspace" was a good key for going back?
